column4: im having a problem playing cds under kubuntu (i just made a fresh installation of the latest kubuntu version) , mp3s work nice system sounds too but when i try to play a cd under any music player i don t get any sound or (on kaffeine) i get an error message! what should i do?
you can use mplayer cdda://
you can use xmms and xmms-cdread
can you play the cd from a VT?
alt-<F1> and login to a VT
im a newbie so waht does VT means?
use mplayer and see if you can make it go
virtual terminal
you can also use cdplay, it is int the cdtools package; apt-get install cdtools
unless of couse you want to use the best media player on earth, mplayer
im guessing im using Konsole (thats the only terminal i know of :( )
in your konsole type apt-get install cdtools  that will install cdplay and allow you to play cd's without kde or gnome or foo
just use sudo vim
you will be done in 2 min
you have to be root
try this in a konsole
sudo vim /etc/apt/sources.list
I can help you edit it with a real editor
you have to use like 8 key presses max to change and save exit the file
all you are doing is remove one or two #'s depending on if you want the src deb's
do it do it :)
how do i save the file on VIM?
to be fair, <SHIFT> zz will save and close the file, :w  will write the file and :wc will write and close the file
